dt: {bc}an agricultural implement consisting of a curved metal blade with a short handle fitted on a tang
{bc}the cutting mechanism (as of a reaper, combine, or mower) consisting of a bar with a series of cutting elements

et: Middle English {it}sikel{/it}, from Old English {it}sicol{/it}, from Latin {it}secula{/it} sickle, from {it}secare{/it} to cut {ma}{mat|saw|}{/ma}
shortdef: an agricultural implement consisting of a curved metal blade with a short handle fitted on a tang
the cutting mechanism (as of a reaper, combine, or mower) consisting of a bar with a series of cutting elements

dt: {bc}having the form of a sickle blade {bc}having a curve similar to that of a sickle blade

shortdef: having the form of a sickle blade : having a curve similar to that of a sickle blade

dt: {bc}to mow or reap with a sickle
{bc}to change (a red blood cell) into a sickle cell

dt.t: the ability of red blood cells to {wi}sickle{/wi}

shortdef: to mow or reap with a sickle
to change (a red blood cell) into a sickle cell
to change into a sickle cell

dt: {bc}an abnormal red blood cell of crescent shape

shortdef: an abnormal red blood cell of crescent shape

dt: {bc}a chronic inherited anemia that occurs primarily in individuals of African, Mediterranean, or southwest Asian ancestry who are homozygous for the gene controlling hemoglobin S and that is characterized especially by episodic blocking of small blood vessels by sickle cells

shortdef: a chronic inherited anemia that occurs primarily in individuals of African, Mediterranean, or southwest Asian ancestry who are homozygous for the gene controlling hemoglobin S and that is characterized especially by episodic blocking of small blood vessels by sickle cells —called also sickle cell disease

dt: {bc}an inherited usually asymptomatic blood condition in which some red blood cells tend to sickle but usually not enough to produce anemia and that occurs primarily in individuals of African, Mediterranean, or southwest Asian ancestry who are heterozygous for the gene controlling hemoglobin S

shortdef: an inherited usually asymptomatic blood condition in which some red blood cells tend to sickle but usually not enough to produce anemia and that occurs primarily in individuals of African, Mediterranean, or southwest Asian ancestry who are heterozygous for the gene controlling hemoglobin S

dt: {bc}an emblem consisting of a crossed hammer and sickle used especially as a symbol of Soviet Communism

shortdef: an emblem consisting of a crossed hammer and sickle used especially as a symbol of Soviet Communism
